com.tambapps.gmage.color

Class Color

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tambapps.gmage.color.Color

  • public class Color
extends Object
    Represents a color Alpha, red, green, blue value go from 0 to 255 included Default Integer values are interpreted as RGB values (alpha is considered as its maximum by default) other Number values are considered as ARGB

    Careful! int/Integer values represent RGB Color but other Numbers represents ARGB values! This can sometimes be tricky in Groovy: 0xffffffff is Long, so not Integer 0x00ffffff is Integer 0xffffff is Integer cast explicitly if you want to be sure to have the desired constructor

      • fromHexString

        public static Color fromHexString(String hex)
        Constructs a Color from the supplied hexadecimal string. The string can start with a '#'. It can represent a ARGB or RGB color
        Parameters:
        hex - the hexadecimal string to decode
        Returns:
        the decoded color

      • differencePercentage2

        public float differencePercentage2(Color color)
        Computes the squared difference percentage between this and the argument. This percentage is the squared of ( the distance between the two colors divided by the maximum distance possible between two colors )
        Parameters:
        color - a color
        Returns:
        the squared difference percentage

      • differencePercentage2

        Returns:
        the squared difference percentage
